author: sky.cactus
content: Doesn't this go away *mostly* in 1559 due to transaction fee rewards being so small?  Still matters at infinity, but doesn't matter until something like 1M gas blocks.

author: .vbuterin
content: You might be thinking of a different effect, where in a non-EIP-1559 and fee-dominated chain, the minimal uncle-risk-compensating fee goes up in cases where the fees of other transactions are higher

author: .vbuterin
content: In fact, that creates weird mechanics when there is *no* block reward, because it weirdly implies that potentially _any_ fee level can be an equilibrium for partially filled blocks, if uncle risk is too high for miners to be willing to fill the blocks completely

author: .vbuterin
content: Or rather, if there is no block reward, the equilibrium block size depends on the shape of the fee demand curve, and not its magnitude (!!)

author: .vbuterin
content: Fortunately, 1559 does bring us further away from such a strange and unstable world
